intro: Licania micrantha subsp. atabapoensis, commonly known as the Atabapo licania, is a shrub or small tree native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its natural habitat.
